data.question: Underlying kernel is common to all types of Linux distributions.
Fedora Linux is a branch of Debian Linux.
Richard Stallman is associated with:
Ken Thompson is associated with:
Linus Torvalds is associated with:
Dennis Richie is associated with:
With ______, the source code is made available to the public.
Microsoft Windows is ______ software.
Adobe Acrobat  is ______.
______ is free for a limited use/time.
A  Linux distribution is a collection of bundle software containing the Linux kernel and libraries, combined with add-on software specific to a certain use.
Which statement best describes a process?
data.correct_answer: A program being executed in memory and performing a task
data.incorrect_answers__001: An executable file stored on a disk
data.incorrect_answers__002: A piece of hardware soldered on a motherboard
data.incorrect_answers__003: A series of steps to achieve a task
incorrect_answers: An executable file stored on a disk
A piece of hardware soldered on a motherboard
A series of steps to achieve a task
data.answer1: A program being executed in memory and performing a task
data.answer2: An executable file stored on a disk
data.answer3: A piece of hardware soldered on a motherboard
data.answer4: A series of steps to achieve a task

data.question: What is a hacker in early days of UNIX?
data.correct_answer: A person who attempts to expand their knowledge of computing through experimentation
data.incorrect_answers__001: A person who gains unauthorized access to computers
data.incorrect_answers__002: A person who is a wacker
data.incorrect_answers__003: A person who cuts wood with heavy blows
incorrect_answers: A person who gains unauthorized access to computers
A person who is a wacker
A person who cuts wood with heavy blows
data.answer1: A person who attempts to expand their knowledge of computing through experimentation
data.answer2: A person who gains unauthorized access to computers
data.answer3: A person who is a wacker
data.answer4: A person who cuts wood with heavy blows

data.question: GNU General Public License stipulates that the source code of any software published under its license must be freely available. If someone modifies that source, that person must also redistribute that source code freely.
Which one is NOT an implication of Open Source Software (OSS)?
data.correct_answer: Software will receive a high bid from potential buyers of the project
data.incorrect_answers__001: Software features evolve quickly based on users needs
data.incorrect_answers__002: Software bugs are noted and promptly fixed
data.incorrect_answers__003: Software is developed rapidly through widespread collaboration
incorrect_answers: Software features evolve quickly based on users needs
Software bugs are noted and promptly fixed
Software is developed rapidly through widespread collaboration
data.answer1: Software will receive a high bid from potential buyers of the project
data.answer2: Software features evolve quickly based on users needs
data.answer3: Software bugs are noted and promptly fixed
data.answer4: Software is developed rapidly through widespread collaboration

data.question: How can you tell if your Linux OS has a development kernel?
data.correct_answer: Kernel version includes the postfix -rc* where * is a number  or Kernel version has an odd numbered minor number if it is a pre-2.6.0 release
data.incorrect_answers__001: Kernel version has an odd numbered minor number if it is a pre-2.6.0 release or The desktop screen will display 'Development Kernel'
data.incorrect_answers__002: The desktop screen will display 'Development Kernel' or The OS will terminate abruptly and frequently
data.incorrect_answers__003: The OS will terminate abruptly and frequently or Kernel version includes the postfix -rc* where * is a number
incorrect_answers: Kernel version has an odd numbered minor number if it is a pre-2.6.0 release or The desktop screen will display 'Development Kernel'
The desktop screen will display 'Development Kernel' or The OS will terminate abruptly and frequently
The OS will terminate abruptly and frequently or Kernel version includes the postfix -rc* where * is a number
data.answer1: Kernel version includes the postfix -rc* where * is a number  or Kernel version has an odd numbered minor number if it is a pre-2.6.0 release
data.answer2: Kernel version has an odd numbered minor number if it is a pre-2.6.0 release or The desktop screen will display 'Development Kernel'
data.answer3: The desktop screen will display 'Development Kernel' or The OS will terminate abruptly and frequently
data.answer4: The OS will terminate abruptly and frequently or Kernel version includes the postfix -rc* where * is a number

data.question: The /root user account is created during the installation process; however, the associated root password is NOT set during the install.
What do you need to install Linux on a stand-alone PC? (Select three)
data.correct_answer: PC, USB flash drive or DVD, Fedora ISO image
data.incorrect_answers__002: PC, USB flash drive or DVD, Screwdriver
data.incorrect_answers__003: USB flash drive or DVD, Fedora ISO image, Screwdriver
incorrect_answers: PC, USB flash drive or DVD, Screwdriver
USB flash drive or DVD, Fedora ISO image, Screwdriver
data.answer1: PC, USB flash drive or DVD, Fedora ISO image
data.answer3: PC, USB flash drive or DVD, Screwdriver
data.answer4: USB flash drive or DVD, Fedora ISO image, Screwdriver

data.question:
What will be the output?
[user1@localhost ~]$ echo $HOME
/home/user1
[user1@localhost ~]$ echo 'This is my \$HOME'
Which one is NOT true for MBR?
data.incorrect_answers__001: Extended partition can be divided into logical drives
data.incorrect_answers__002: One partition can be extended partition
incorrect_answers: Extended partition can be divided into logical drives
One partition can be extended partition
data.answer2: Extended partition can be divided into logical drives
data.answer3: One partition can be extended partition

data.question: What are two commands you can use to power down the Linux machine immediately?
What are two things $ su - command will do?
data.correct_answer: Load the root user's environmental variables and Login as the root user
data.incorrect_answers__001: Login as the root user and  Display the summary list of root user's processes
data.incorrect_answers__002: Login as the root user and Display $ as the shell prompt
data.incorrect_answers__003: Display the summary list of root user's processes and Display $ as the shell prompt
incorrect_answers: Login as the root user and  Display the summary list of root user's processes
Login as the root user and Display $ as the shell prompt
Display the summary list of root user's processes and Display $ as the shell prompt
data.answer1: Load the root user's environmental variables and Login as the root user
data.answer2: Login as the root user and  Display the summary list of root user's processes
data.answer3: Login as the root user and Display $ as the shell prompt
data.answer4: Display the summary list of root user's processes and Display $ as the shell prompt

data.question: Which commands could be used to receive helpful information on Linux or shell commands? (Select three)

[root@localhost dev]#
__________
tty6 tty60 tty61 tty62 tty63
The more command supports the use of arrow keys to navigate while less command does not.
Which one is NOT a popular text editor on Linux?

Which command was entered at ____________________? (Select two)
[user1@localhost gdm]$pwd
/etc/gdm
[user1@localhost gdm]$____________________
[user1@localhost share]$ pwd
/usr/share
Which statement is true for the regular expression metacharacter '?' ?
data.correct_answer: Matches 0 or 1 occurrences of the previous character
data.incorrect_answers__001: Matches 0 or more occurrences of the previous character
data.incorrect_answers__002: Matches 1 or more occurrences of the previous character
data.incorrect_answers__003: Matches 1 occurrence of the previous character
incorrect_answers: Matches 0 or more occurrences of the previous character
Matches 1 or more occurrences of the previous character
Matches 1 occurrence of the previous character
data.answer1: Matches 0 or 1 occurrences of the previous character
data.answer2: Matches 0 or more occurrences of the previous character
data.answer3: Matches 1 or more occurrences of the previous character
data.answer4: Matches 1 occurrence of the previous character

data.question: Identify the relative path names. (Select two)
Which command was given for the output below?

Which line will be displayed with the following command?
$ grep '^I' file1

Which line will NOT be displayed with the following command?
$ grep tio* file1
Which command is NOT used to display the content of a text file?

What does the following command do?
setfacl -m u:user1:rwx file1
data.correct_answer: Allow user1 to become an additional owner of file1
data.incorrect_answers__001: Assign user1 a faculty role on file1
data.incorrect_answers__002: Assign user1 to become the sole owner of file1
data.incorrect_answers__003: Allow user1 to become an additional group member of file1
incorrect_answers: Assign user1 a faculty role on file1
Assign user1 to become the sole owner of file1
Allow user1 to become an additional group member of file1
data.answer1: Allow user1 to become an additional owner of file1
data.answer2: Assign user1 a faculty role on file1
data.answer3: Assign user1 to become the sole owner of file1
data.answer4: Allow user1 to become an additional group member of file1

data.question: rmdir deletes the specified directory only if the directory is empty.

data.answer4: Open and read the content of the file and Execute the file

data.question:

data.answer2: Enter the directory and Add or remove files to and from the directory
data.answer3: Enter the directory and Add or remove files to and from the directory

data.question: If you have the write permission to a certain directory but no permission to files within it, you could delete all of those files.
